compress.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller
compress.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Light silk is best for parachutes, as it compresses well and then expands rapidly.
The miners used rock drills and compressed air to drive through hard rock.
Snow falling on the mountainsides is compressed into ice.
compress.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make a computer file smaller by using a special computer program, which makes the file easier to store or send, or to become smaller in this way
compress.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The program compresses any data saved to the disk.
compress.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to write or express something using fewer words
compress.translation[0].definitions[2].e: In this chapter we compress into summary form the main issues discussed so far.
compress.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to reduce the amount of time that it takes for something to happen or be done
compress.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Many couples want to compress their childbearing into a short space of time in their married life.
compress.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a small thick piece of material that you put on part of someoneâ€™s body to stop blood flowing out or to make it less painful
compress.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Apply a cold compress to the injury.
compress.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to make a computer file smaller, so that it takes up less space and is easier to store or send
compress.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Compressing data reduces storage and communication costs.
